awd_titl_txt: Physics of Plasma Confined by a Dipole Magnetic Field
awd_abstract_narration: A new and innovative experimental research is proposed to                  study collisionless plasma processes in the controlled laboratory               configuration.  The plasma in a dipole magnetic field simulates                 the earth's magnetosphere.  The advances in the diagnostic                      methods (non-intrusive) make possible reliable measurements of                  radial profiles of temperature and density.  These are                          significant improvements over the old terrela-type experiments.                 The experimental observations are to be studied with theoretical                work.  Nonlinear wave interactions, hot trapped particle                        instability, interchange instability will theoretically be                      studied.  The results from theory and experiment should advance                 understanding of basic physics and magnetospheric plasma                        processes.
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences
